answers.answer: Headaches can be linked to blood sugar. Have you checked yours recently?
I haven't seen a Dr to get a means to check it. I don't have any way to check! That's why I'm worried.
How do you know you are diabetic then? Usually once you are diagnosed with diabetes they set you up with insulin. (If needed) and all your testing supplies.
The doctor called on Wednesday and said the test was positive, then they set up the appointment for July. Would you go to the ER? I feel dumb asking, but idk what else I can do.

Which test was it that you had done? If it was the 1hr usually they'll just have you do the 3hr. If your 1hr was high enough sometimes they'll skip it but in that case they'd usually bring you in sooner.... In any case if your headaches aren't going away regardless of what you do, you should be checked. It is not stupid to go to the ER, that's what they are there for. If you don't feel like going there you could also maybe see if you have an urgent care center in your area?
I had the 1hr and then the 3hr. Unfortunately my obgyn doesn't care for high risk so I had to make an appointment with the high risk Dr and they don't have anything until July.

Ahhh that explains a lot, thank you. Like I said earlier though if nothing is helping your headache you should be seen. Either an ER or urgent care center will be fine, but it'd be best to have your blood sugar checked as well as your blood pressure.

question: I am a ftm 9wks 3days, found out 3 days ago that I do have diabetes. I don't see my Dr until July 2nd. I have had an iintense headache for two days. Can that be linked to a blood sugar issue? I just want to no if I should just go to the ER. I've tried Tylenol, drinking water, caffeine, a little extra sleep... nothing even subdues it a little bit...
title: gestational diabetes question...
